required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Viscoelastic Properties of Lower Extremity's Muscles
clinical_study.official_title: The Mechanical Characteristics of Lower Extremity Muscles in Healthy Individuals Using Myotonometric Assessment

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to create normative values for stiffness, tonus and elasticity in the lower extremity muscles and to determine age and gender differences.

primary_outcome.description: The muscle tone, stiffness and elasticity of participants are assessed with myoton device for creating normative data

intervention.description: Vertically placed on the muscle, a probe (3 mm diameter) creates constant pre-excitations (0.18 N) and generates short-term (15 ms), low-force (0.4 N) mechanical stimulations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals without any systemic or metabolic diseases, psychological illnesses, or drug abuse; those without any diseases that could cause muscle disease or muscle atrophy; and those who had not undergone any surgery in the musculoskeletal system during the past 3 months were included
Exclusion Criteria:
-

results_reference.citation: Correa-de-Araujo R, Harris-Love MO, Miljkovic I, Fragala MS, Anthony BW, Manini TM. The Need for Standardized Assessment of Muscle Quality in Skeletal Muscle Function Deficit and Other Aging-Related Muscle Dysfunctions: A Symposium Report. Front Physiol. 2017 Feb 15;8:87. doi: 10.3389/fphys.2017.00087. eCollection 2017. Review.
Perkisas, S., et al., Physiological and architectural changes in the ageing muscle and their relation to strength and function in sarcopenia. European Geriatric Medicine, 2016. 7(3): p. 201-206
